metadata.title: CVE-2014-3686 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
wpa_supplicant and hostapd 0.7.2 through 2.2, when running with certainconfigurations and using wpa_cli or hostapd_cli with action scripts, allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted frame.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3686` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:2.1-0ubuntu1.1
wpagui - 2.1-0ubuntu1.1
wpasupplicant - 2.1-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.1').
wpa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.1').
